com.opower.connectionpool

Class SQLConnectionFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.opower.connectionpool.SQLConnectionFactory
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ConnectionFactory

    public class SQLConnectionFactory
extends Object
implements ConnectionFactory
    A factory for creating connections for accessing and processing data stored in a data source (usually a relational database)
    Author:
    dhagan
    See Also:
    DriverManager.getConnection(java.lang.String, java.util.Properties)

    • Constructor Detail

      • SQLConnectionFactory

        public SQLConnectionFactory(String driverClassName,
                    String url,
                    String user,
                    String password)
                     throws Exception

        Creates a new SQLConnectionFactory object.

        NOTED: The DataSource interface, new in the JDBC 2.0 API, provides another way to connect to a data source. The use of a DataSource object is the preferred means of connecting to a data source

        Parameters:
        driverClassName -
        url - a database url of the form jdbc:subprotocol:subname
        user - the database user on whose behalf the connection is being made
        password - the user's password
        Throws:
        Exception
        See Also:
        DriverManager

    • Method Detail

      • getConnection

        public Connection getConnection()
                         throws SQLException

        Attempts to establish a connection to the given database URL. The DriverManager attempts to select an appropriate driver from the set of registered JDBC drivers.

        Specified by:
        getConnection in interface ConnectionFactory
        Returns:
        a connection
        Throws:
        SQLException
        See Also:
        DriverManager.getConnection(java.lang.String, java.util.Properties)
